column12: DIHYDROIMIDAZO[2,1-B]THIAZOLE AND DIHYDRO-5H-THIAZOLO[3,2-A]PYRIMIDINE DERIVATIVES WITH 5-HT RECEPTOR AFFINITY
column13: The present invention relates to certain novel substituted dihydroimidazo[2,1-b]thiazole and dihydro-5H-thiazolo[3,2-a]pyrimidine compounds of Formula (I) which have affinity for 5-HT1A receptors and which inhibit neuronal reuptake of 5-hydroxytryptamine and/or noradrenaline, to processes for their preparation, to pharmaceutical compositions containing them and to their use in the treatment of depression, anxiety, psychoses (for example schizophrenia), tardive dyskinesia, obesity, drug addiction, drug abuse, cognitive disorders, Alzheimer's disease, obsessive-compulsive behaviour, panic attacks, social phobias, eating disorders such as bulimia, anorexia, snacking and binge eating, non-insulin dependent diabetes mellitus, hyperglycaemia, hyperlipidaemia, stress, as an aid to smoking cessation and in the treatment and/or prophylaxis of seizures, neurological disorders such as epilepsy and/or conditions in which there is neurological damage such as stroke, brain trauma, cerebral ischaemia, head injuries and haemorrhage.
column14: KNOLL GMBH;;BROUGH PAUL;;WATTS JOHN PAUL;;COCKROFT VICTOR;;KERRIGAN FRANK;;DOYLE KEVIN JAMES

column32: SHARPE C J ET AL: "PHENACYLTHIOIMIDAZOLINES AND 3-ARYL-5,6-DIHYDROIMIDAZO[2,1-B]THIAZOLES WITH ANTIDEPRESSANT ACTIVITY", JOURNAL OF MEDICINAL CHEMISTRY, AMERICAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY. WASHINGTON, US, vol. 14, no. 10, 1971, pages 977 - 982, XP002015395, ISSN: 0022-2623

column12: Dihydroimidazo(2,1-b)thiazole and dihydro-5h-thiazolo(3,2-a)pyrimidine derivatives with 5-ht receptor affinity
